poem:
### Silent Ledger

Across the ledger of loss,  
numbers blur into colors,  
tones of a muted spectrum.  
Youth stumbles under the weight  
of invisible burdens,  
while history whispers  
from inked pages  
into the hushed rooms  
of those who remain,  
haunted by the absence,  
by the unkept promise  
of tomorrow's breath.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. And in two groups – Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander and Native American or Alaska Native – working-age people (ages 25 to 64) had the greatest increase in mortality". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
